security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and code examples for the Vercel AI SDK integration. All static findings are false positives: backticks in code examples were misidentified as shell commands, and legitimate API key environment variable usage follows Next.js security best practices. No executable code or security risks detected.

content.user_title: Build AI Apps with Vercel AI SDK
content.value_statement: Building AI-powered applications requires complex integration of LLMs, streaming, and state management. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for implementing chatbots, structured outputs, generative UI, and agent workflows using the Vercel AI SDK in Next.js applications.
actual_capabilities: Implement streaming chat interfaces with useChat and streamText
Generate structured JSON outputs with type safety using generateObject and Zod schemas
Build generative UI applications that stream React components from the server
Create background AI agents with Inngest for long-running workflows
Configure multiple LLM providers including OpenAI and Anthropic
Handle multimodal inputs with image attachments in chat interfaces
limitations: Focused on Vercel AI SDK only, not other AI frameworks or image generation
Examples are specific to Next.js App Router architecture
Requires existing knowledge of React, TypeScript, and Next.js fundamentals
Does not cover deployment, monitoring, or production optimization strategies

output_examples.input: Create a streaming chat API route at /api/chat with authentication
output_examples.output: I will create a streaming chat API route with authentication. The route will use streamText from the Vercel AI SDK with OpenAI, include authentication via withAuthRequired, and return a streaming response with token usage tracking.

output_examples.input: Build an endpoint that extracts structured recipe data from text
output_examples.output: I will create an API route using generateObject with a Zod schema that defines recipe structure including name, ingredients array, and preparation steps, ensuring type-safe JSON output.

output_examples.input: How do I handle multimodal chat with image uploads?
output_examples.output: For multimodal chat, use the experimental_attachments parameter in useChat's handleSubmit function. On the client, capture file inputs and pass them to handleSubmit. The server route will receive images in the messages array for processing.

best_practices: Always use authentication on AI API routes to prevent unauthorized access and control costs
Prefer streaming responses for text generation to improve perceived performance
Define Zod schemas for structured outputs to ensure type safety and validation
anti_patterns: Exposing AI routes without authentication leads to abuse and unexpected costs
Running long AI workflows in standard API routes will hit serverless timeout limits
Hardcoding API keys in code instead of using environment variables compromises security

faq.question: When should I use ai-sdk-handler versus ai-handler?
faq.answer: Use ai-sdk-handler for text-based LLM features including chat, structured outputs, and agents. Use ai-handler for image and video generation with services like Replicate or Fal.ai.

faq.question: How do I prevent API route timeouts for long AI tasks?
faq.answer: Use Inngest integration for workflows that exceed serverless limits. Trigger Inngest events from your UI and run multi-step AI logic in background functions with automatic retries and step tracking.

faq.question: Can I use multiple LLM providers in the same application?
faq.answer: Yes, configure multiple providers in your AI library file. You can use OpenAI, Anthropic, or other supported providers and switch between them by passing different model instances to streamText or generateObject.

faq.question: How do I handle authentication in AI routes?
faq.answer: Wrap your route handlers with withAuthRequired to verify user sessions. Always check session.user.id before processing requests and consider logging usage per user for cost tracking.

faq.question: What is generative UI and when should I use it?
faq.answer: Generative UI uses streamUI to render React components from the server based on LLM decisions. Use it for dashboards or interfaces that need dynamic component rendering based on AI analysis.

faq.question: How do I cache AI responses to reduce costs?
faq.answer: Use Next.js unstable_cache to cache responses for identical queries. Set appropriate revalidation times based on your use case. This works well for repetitive queries or reference data.
